column4: hi everybody! I have a strange effect on ubuntu (on a 2009 mac mini with Nvidia): http://www.youtube.com/watch_popup?v=J1OqqQ8hBXk&vq=medium      this video has a blueshift when played in firefox.
now it plays with no blueshift in chrome, but then it sputters and stutters
does anyone have an explanation for this?
You have adobe flash and gstreamer plugins installed and up to date?
yes. the restricted extras are installed and all updates applied
It almost sounds like hardware accelleration for video playback isn't enabled or is too underpowered to handle the video. Are other videos played back successfully? Even HD videos?
regular mkv files or avi files on the hard drive play fine... even plays ok in minitube
regular mkv files or avi files on the hard drive play fine... even plays ok in minitube
by the way everything played great on when booted in to OSX
how do I enable hardware acceleration for the nvidia drivers?
you may be right on the no acceleration for video... because the cpu does run high when flash video is played...
I was trying to see if I could play the video with youtube's HTML5 video player, but I'm not having success.  Do you have proprietary drivers enabled/installed?
tried with vlc and it plays fine... yes the nvidia drivers are installed.
Sounds like a flash/browser issue then. I'm at a loss as to where to go from here. =\
I tried to enable prefer html5 but could not figure out how...
ok I will google some more..
I enabled "Override automatic cache management" on firefox. it worked
